content:
two blood clots in his arm have made his chance at future play unknown PERIOD

FAU quarterback DeAndre Johnson  prepares to throw a ball to his teammate during practice play PERIOD Alex Rodriguez  Photo Editor

Benjamin Paley News EditorSeptember  

After playing only one game for the Owls quarterback DeAndre Johnson has been hospitalized at Boca Raton Regional Hospital PERIOD

Head coach Lane Kiffin told reporters Monday that Johnson has a scary medical condition PERIOD

Johnsons father Earl posted on Facebook that his son has two blood clots in his arm and would be undergoing surgery the Sun Sentinel reported PERIOD The quarterback has struggled with an undisclosed injury since early August but Kiffin didnt comment as to whether it was the same medical issue Johnson currently faces PERIOD

The former FSU quarterback was admitted to the hospital Thursday Sept PERIOD  sports outlet Owl Access said PERIOD He remains there as of Tuesday night PERIOD

His hospitalization came the day after the Owls traveled to the University of WisconsinMadison for their Saturday Sept PERIOD  game PERIOD

Daniel Parr substituted for Johnson as quarterback against the Badgers PERIOD

It looks as if Parr will once again start as quarterback in the Owls home game against BethuneCookman this Saturday PERIOD

In regard to the situation Kiffin said I would say that as of right now yes. benjamin Paley is the news editor of the University Press PERIOD For information regarding this or other stories email emailprotected PERIOD

Benjamin is a graduate student studying public administration and has previously been a contributing writer PERIOD He hopes to work on Capitol Hill one day... PERIOD
